com.k2.Html5Builder

Class Html5Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.k2.XMLBuilder.XMLBuilder
      • com.k2.Html5Builder.Html5Builder

  • public class Html5Builder
extends com.k2.XMLBuilder.XMLBuilder
    This class is the starting point for interaction with the Html5Builder API
    Author:
    simon

    • Constructor Detail

      • Html5Builder

        public Html5Builder()
        Create an instance of the Html5Builder that will uses a blank value, i.e. no '=' and value statement for attributes that have been defined with a null value

      • setUAgentInfo

        public Html5Builder setUAgentInfo(UserAgentInfo uaInfo)
        Set the user agent details for this instance of the html builder
        Parameters:
        uaInfo - An instance of UserAgentInfo representing the user agent details requesting the html content
        Returns:
        This html builder for method chaining.

      • getUAgentInto

        public UserAgentInfo getUAgentInto()
        Get the user agent information associated with this html builder
        Returns:
        The user agent information for which this html builder is generating html content

      • uaIs

        public boolean uaIs(UserAgentInfo.UserAgentType... agentTypes)
        A utility method to identify whether the user agent is one of the given user agent types
        Parameters:
        agentTypes - A set of user agent types to check against the user agent info.
        Returns:
        True if the user agent is in the given list of user agent types

      • uaOk

        public boolean uaOk(UserAgentInfo.UserAgentType checkType)
        A utility method to check the current user agent information against the given user agent type
        Parameters:
        checkType - The user agent type to compare to the current user agent info
        Returns:
        True if the given type is the same as the current user agent type

      • uaOk

        public boolean uaOk(UserAgentInfo.UserAgentType checkType,
                    java.lang.Integer checkVer)
        A utility method to compare the current user agent to the given type and version
        Parameters:
        checkType - The type to compare to the current user agent
        checkVer - The version to compare to the current user agent
        Returns:
        True if the current user agent is of the given type and greater than or equal to the check version

      • setWarngingLog

        public Html5Builder setWarngingLog(java.util.logging.Logger warningLog)
        Set the warning logger. If this method has not been called to set the warning logger then a default annonymous logger is used. It is not always possible to prevent invalid html begin defined through the API. In these cases the invalidity of the html is reported on the warning log rather than throwing an unchecked exception and fail to generate the html
        Parameters:
        warningLog - An instance of Logger to use as the warning logger.
        Returns:
        This html builder for method chaining

      • warning

        public void warning(java.lang.String message)
        Add the given message to the warning log
        Parameters:
        message - The message to log as a warning

      • page

        public HtmlPage page()
        This method creates and returns a new html page The created page will by default allow optional end tags. i.e. not XHTML compliant
        Returns:
        The created instance of HtmlPage representing the new html page

      • page

        public HtmlPage page(boolean includeXmlProlog,
                     boolean allowOptionalEndTags,
                     boolean system,
                     java.lang.String fpi,
                     java.lang.String url)
        This method creates and returns a new html page. This method allows control over all the details of the xml prolog
        Parameters:
        includeXmlProlog - True if the Xml prolog should be included
        allowOptionalEndTags - True if end tags are optional on empty elements. Note End tags are required for XTHML documents
        system - True if the DOCTYPE is a system document rather than a public document
        fpi - The string representing the 'fpi' portion of the DOCTYPE tag.
        url - The string representing the 'url' portion of the DOCTYPE tag.
        Returns:
        The newly created html page

      • xHtmlPage

        public HtmlPage xHtmlPage()
        This method creates an html page with the DOCTYPE appropriate for an xhtml page conforming to the html5 standard.
        Returns:
        The newly created xhtml page

      • element

        public <E extends HtmlGlobalElement> E element(java.lang.Class<E> elementClass)
        Create an instance of the given class that is an extension of the HtmlGlobalElement being the base class of all html elements.
        Type Parameters:
        E - The concrete implementation of the html element desired from the html builder
        Parameters:
        elementClass - The class representing the html element to create
        Returns:
        The created html element instance
